intro: Anchusa angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Anchusa angustissima is known for its ornamental value, particularly in gardens where its vibrant flowers add color during the summer months. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
